intro: Hieracium atramentarium, commonly known as the black hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are heart-shaped and often lobed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in flat-topped clusters, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium atramentarium is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, thriving in a variety of light conditions.
